title: Many will disagree with me, but Zhonya is now a much better purchase
body:
Yes, it lost AP. Yes, its active has a higher cooldown. However, the fact that not only it has a lower price, but also a better build path - I can buy a Seeker's Armguard and then another amplifying tome (which I can then upgrade to a Fiendish Codex, making the final combine cost even lower), which helps especially if I am behind - means that this item is much less awkward to buy. No longer, when behind, I will have to farm and hope that I can get 1250 gold for the NLR then spend another thousand gold just to complete this item. Did I mention that it has cooldown reduction now, too?

While one can argue that the nerfs to the AP amount and the higher cooldown were unecessary changes, this item is, in general, in a better state than before. It is not the perfect solution to the lack of itemization for AP mages against AD assassins, but it is better than before.

I remember that. I also remember that it was so fucking good it was core on basically every AP midlaner with the defensive active being a cherry on the top.

Which is funny because mage players are complaining about Maw for the exact same reasons.

Full disclosure: I don't have a horse in the Zhonya's race because I hate the item and have rarely played champs that required it as a core item (aside from Lissandra). 

The issue with Maw, imo, is not that it's powerful but that it's power is entirely passive. Zhonya's has a skill element that is virtually absent altogether from Maw. Maw procs when you're in a cc, when you're out of position, and when you would be assassinated without time to react. In other words, it passively requires less skill from the AD and more skill from the AP. 

Zhonya's doesn't do that. If you're caught out, and use Zhonya's, you'll probably die anyway. If you're cc'd you can't use the active. If you're assassinated before you can hit the button, you die anyway. Outside of full-swing teamfights or inherent kit synergy (eg Fiddles, Morg, Heimer, etc), Zhonya's isn't a great "oh crap" button to compensate for mistakes. 

In general, Maw gives a much larger EHP advantage than Zhonya's due to the MR + Shield + LifeSteal + Pen. Maw is just a vastly superior dueling item.

Don't forget that Zhonya's makes you untargetable, so unless you timed it perfectly, the enemy still has the spell ready to go for when you pop back out. Maw gives a shield that you have to beat through, wasting spellcasts and damage potential.

The problem with Zhonya's is that it has some clear abuse cases. It's intended to prevent being focused in teamfights and as defensive item in AD matchups.

However, it has also has a situational but very powerful function as engage enabler. Lissandra, Azir, TF and maybr a couplr of others can jump straight in the middle of the enemy team. There is a huge difference in power between the average defensive use and the sitiational offensive engage use, which means it can never be balanced around both of them.

If they really wanted to make it not a dual-purpose item, they'd make the special effect something on the order of "puts you in stasis for X seconds, rendering you untargetable and preventing all damage dealt and taken."
